description: Change of use of ground floor from (Use Class E(b) restaurant to hot food takeaway (Use class Sui Generis); installation of extractors to rear elevation, extraction flue, three freestanding condensers
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 10 (Existing GA); 20 (Proposed GA); 30 (Shopfront Elevations); 31 (Rear Elevations); 51 (Setting Out Plan); QI01672-NFG-ZZ-DR-01 Rev 0 (Proposed Air Conditioning & Ventilation).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an odour risk assessment (according to 2018 EMAQ Guidance) and of odour abatement equipment and extract system, including operational details and maintenance schedule, the height of the extract duct, with vertical discharge outlet, without cowl, at least 1m above the eaves of the main building. Details shall be provided of a reasonable distance of the extract outlet approximately 20.0meters from any openable window unless effective odour control is installed. Approved details shall be implemented prior to use and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell or steam, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The plant/ machinery/ equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/ mechanical installations hereby approved shall be installed in strict accordance with the details provided in the report titled 'Acoustic Assessment at 9 Hanger Green London, Document Ref: 152223, Rev A, Date: 01/12/2022, Author: N Johnson MSc. MIOA'. The plant/ machinery/ equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/ mechanical installations shall thereafter be retained as approved. The plant shall not be used unless the equipment is installed in compliance with these details.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The use shall not commence until all external doors to the kitchen area have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to rooms where noise, smell, smoke or fumes may be emitted, be fixed in an open position.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Provision for refuse and recycling storage in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to commencement of development and shall be made continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage facilities to align with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| A delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation the development hereby approved. The plan shall include details of the location and management of collection vehicles, including scooters, bicycles and motorbikes.

The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policies T3, T4, T6.2 and T7 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 6.13 of the Development Management DPD 2013.
